00130    ControllerTypeEthernet = 1    /* Ethernet controller */

00133 enum TMCSerialHandshake
00134 {
00135    SerialHandshakeNone = 0,      /* No handshake */
00136    SerialHandshakeHardware = 1,  /* Hardware handshake (RTS/CTS) */
00137    SerialHandshakeSoftware = 2   /* Software handshake (XOn/XOff) - not implemented yet */
00138 };
00139 
00140 enum TMCDataRecordAccess
00141 {
00142    DataRecordAccessNone = 0,     /* No data record access capability or data record access is off */
00143    DataRecordAccessDMA = 1,      /* Use DMA for data record access */
00144    DataRecordAccessFIFO = 2      /* Use FIFO for data record access */
00145 };

00148 {
00149    EthernetProtocolTCP = 0,
00150    EthernetProtocolUDP = 1
00151 };

00153 // Ethernet flags
00154 #define ETH_NO_MULTICAST         0x0001   /* Do not open a multi-cast session */
00155 #define ETH_UNSOLICITEDMESSAGES  0x0002   /* Open an unsolicited message session */

00157 // Structures

00159 // Hardware info - ISA and PCI bus
00160 typedef struct _BUSINFO
00161 {
00162         USHORT  usDevice;             /* Device number [0-3] */
00163         USHORT  usAddress;            /* I/O port address */
00164         USHORT  usAddress2;           /* I/O port address for PCI status register */
00165         USHORT  usInterrupt;          /* Interrupt */
00166         USHORT  fDataRecordAccess;    /* Data record access type */
00167         USHORT  usRefreshRate;        /* Data record refresh rate in 2^usRefreshRate ms */
00168         USHORT  usDMAChannel;         /* DMA channel - for DMC-1700 only */
00169         USHORT  fIOStyle;             /* I/O Style - for Galil use only */
00170         USHORT  fInterruptStyle;      /* Interrupt style - for Galil use only */
00171         ULONG   ulReserved1;          /* Reserved for future use */
00172         ULONG   ulReserved2;          /* Reserved for future use */
00173 } BUSINFO;
00174 
00175 // Hardware info - serial communications
00176 typedef struct _SERIALINFO
00177 {
00178    USHORT  usCommPort;           /* Communications port */
00179    ULONG   ulCommSpeed;          /* Communications speed */
00180    USHORT  fHandshake;           /* Communications handshake */
00181    USHORT  usReserved1;          /* Reserved for future use */
00182    USHORT  usReserved2;          /* Reserved for future use */
00183 } SERIALINFO;
00184 
00185 // Hardware info - serial communications
00186 typedef struct _SOCKETINFO
00187 {
00188    ULONG   ulPort;               /* Host port number - for Galil use only */
00189    CHAR    szIPAddress[32];      /* Host name string */
00190    USHORT  fProtocol;            /* UDP or TCP */
00191    ULONG   fFlags;               /* Controls auto opening of multi-cast and unsolicited message sessions */
00192    ULONG   ulReserved1;          /* Reserved for future use */
00193    ULONG   ulReserved2;          /* Reserved for future use */
00194 } SOCKETINFO;
00195 
00196 // Hardware info for CONTROLLERINFO struct
00197 typedef union _HARDWAREINFO
00198 {
00199    BUSINFO     businfo;
00200    SERIALINFO  serialinfo;
00201    SOCKETINFO  socketinfo;
00202 } HARDWAREINFO;
00203 
00204 // Structure used define controller info
00205 typedef struct _CONTROLLERINFO
00206 {
00207    USHORT         cbSize;          // Structure size
00208    USHORT         usModelID;       // Model ID of the Galil controller
00209    USHORT         fControllerType; // Controller type (ISA bus, PCI bus, serial, etc.)
00210    ULONG          ulTimeout;       // Time-out in milliseconds
00211    ULONG          ulDelay;         // Delay in milliseconds
00212    ULONG          ulSerialNumber;  // Serial number
00213    ULONG          ulRelativeNumber;// relative number on the bus
00214    pid_t          pid;             // Process ID
00215    HARDWAREINFO   hardwareinfo;    // Union defining the hardware characteristics of the controller
00216 } CONTROLLERINFO, FAR* PCONTROLLERINFO;

00218 // Function prototypes
00219 // All functions return an error code. DMCNOERROR (0) is function completed
00220 // successfully. Error code < 0 is a fatal error. Error code > 0 is a warning.
00221 // General functions for all controllers

00223 extern LONG FAR TRIOCALL TMCInitLibrary(void);
00224 // Initialize the library.  This function MUST be called before using the library.

00226 extern LONG FAR TRIOCALL TMCOpen(PCONTROLLERINFO pcontrollerinfo, PHANDLETMC phtmc);
00227 /* Open communications with the TRIO controller. The handle to the TRIO
00228    controller is returned in the argument phdmc.
00229 
00230    pcontrollerinfo   Galil controller information. Users should declare a
00231                      variable of type CONTROLLERINFO, fill-in the necessary values,
00232                      and pass the address of the variable to the function.
00233    phdmc             Buffer to receive the handle to the Galil controller to be
00234                      used for all subsequent API calls. Users should declare a
00235                      variable of type HANDLEDMC and pass the address of the
00236                      variable to the function. Output only. */
00237 
00238 extern LONG FAR TRIOCALL TMCClose(HANDLETMC hdmc);
00239 /* Close communications with the Galil controller.
00240 
00241    hdmc              Handle to the Galil controller. */
00242 
00243 extern LONG FAR TRIOCALL TMCCommand(HANDLETMC hdmc, PSZ pszCommand,
00244    PCHAR pchResponse, ULONG cbResponse);
00245 /* Send a DMC command in ascii format to the Galil controller.
00246 
00247    hdmc              Handle to the Galil controller.
00248    pszCommand        The command to send to the Galil controller.
00249    pchResponse       Buffer to receive the response data. If the buffer is too
00250                      small to recieve all the response data from the controller,
00251                      the error code DMCERROR_BUFFERFULL will be returned. The
00252                      user may get additional response data by calling the
00253                      function DMCGetAdditionalResponse. The length of the
00254                      additonal response data may ascertained by call the
00255                      function DMCGetAdditionalResponseLen. If the response
00256                      data from the controller is too large for the internal
00257                      additional response buffer, the error code
00258                      DMCERROR_RESPONSEDATA will be returned. Output only.
00259    cbResponse        Length of the buffer. */
00260 
00261 extern LONG FAR TRIOCALL TMCBinaryCommand(HANDLETMC hdmc, PBYTE pbCommand, ULONG ulCommandLength,
00262    PCHAR pchResponse, ULONG cbResponse);
00263 /* Send a DMC command in binary format to the Galil controller.
00264 
00265    hdmc              Handle to the Galil controller.
00266    pbCommand         The command to send to the Galil controller in binary.
00267    ulCommandLength   The length of the command (binary commands are not null-terminated).
00268    pchResponse       Buffer to receive the response data. If the buffer is too
00269                      small to recieve all the response data from the controller,
00270                      the error code DMCERROR_BUFFERFULL will be returned. The
00271                      user may get additional response data by calling the
00272                      function DMCGetAdditionalResponse. The length of the
00273                      additonal response data may ascertained by call the
00274                      function DMCGetAdditionalResponseLen. If the response
00275                      data from the controller is too large for the internal
00276                      additional response buffer, the error code
00277                      DMCERROR_RESPONSEDATA will be returned. Output only.
00278    cbResponse        Length of the buffer. */
00279 
00280 extern LONG FAR TRIOCALL TMCGetUnsolicitedResponse(HANDLETMC hdmc,
00281    PCHAR pchResponse, ULONG cbResponse);
00282 /* Query the Galil controller for unsolicited responses. These are messages
00283    output from programs running in the background in the Galil controller.
00284    The data placed in the user buffer (pchResponse) is NULL terminated.
00285    NOTE: This function requires that the CW property be set to 1. The DMC
00286    command CW1 makes bit 7 high for characters in all messages which originate
00287    from the controller. This is how the library is able to distinguish between
00288    responses from commands (foreground) and messages from the controller
00289    (background). The DMC command CW2 disables this action.
00290 
00291    hdmc              Handle to the Galil controller.
00292    pchResponse       Buffer to receive the response data.
00293    cbResponse        Length of the buffer. */
00294 
00295 extern LONG FAR TRIOCALL TMCWriteData(HANDLETMC hdmc,
00296    PCHAR pchBuffer, ULONG cbBuffer, PULONG pulBytesWritten);
00297 /* Low-level I/O routine to write data to the Galil controller. Data is written
00298    to the Galil controller only if it is "ready" to receive it. The function
00299    will attempt to write exactly cbBuffer characters to the controller.
00300    NOTE: For Win32 and WinRT driver the maximum number of bytes which can be
00301    written each time is 64. There are no restrictions with the Galil driver. 
00302 
00303    hdmc              Handle to the Galil controller.
00304    pchBuffer         Buffer to write the data from.
00305    cbBuffer          Length of the buffer.
00306    pulBytesWritten   Number of bytes written. */
00307 
00308 extern LONG FAR TRIOCALL TMCReadData(HANDLETMC hdmc,
00309    PCHAR pchBuffer, ULONG cbBuffer, PULONG pulBytesRead);
00310 /* Low-level I/O routine to read data from the Galil controller. The routine
00311    will read what ever is currently in the FIFO (bus controller) or
00312    communications port input queue (serial controller). The function will read
00313    up to cbBuffer characters from the controller. The data placed in the 
00314    user buffer (pchBuffer) is NOT NULL terminated. The data returned is not
00315    guaranteed to be a complete response - you may have to call this function
00316    repeatedly to get a complete response.
00317    NOTE: For Win32 and WinRT driver the maximum number of bytes which can be
00318    read each time is 64. There are no restrictions with the Galil driver. 
00319 
00320    hdmc              Handle to the Galil controller.
00321    pchBuffer         Buffer to read the data into.
00322    cbBuffer          Length of the buffer.
00323    pulBytesRead      Number of bytes read. */
00324 
00325 extern LONG FAR TRIOCALL TMCGetAdditionalResponseLen(HANDLETMC hdmc,
00326    PULONG pulResponseLen);
00327 /* Query the Galil controller for the length of additional response data. There
00328    will be more response data available if the DMCCommand function returned
00329    DMCERROR_BUFFERFULL.
00330 
00331    hdmc              Handle to the Galil controller.
00332    pulResponseLen    Buffer to receive the additional response data length.
00333                      Output only. */
00334 
00335 extern LONG FAR TRIOCALL TMCGetAdditionalResponse(HANDLETMC hdmc,
00336    PCHAR pchResponse, ULONG cbResponse);
00337 /* Query the Galil controller for more response data. There will be more
00338    response data available if the DMCCommand function returned
00339    DMCERROR_BUFFERFULL. Once this function is called, the internal
00340    additonal response buffer is cleared.
00341 
00342    hdmc              Handle to the Galil controller.
00343    pchResponse       Buffer to receive the response data. Output only.
00344    cbResponse        Length of the buffer. */
00345

00347    ULONG cbMessage);

00349 
00350    hdmc              Handle to the Galil controller.
00351    pchMessage        Buffer to receive the error message text. Output only.
00352    cbMessage         Length of the buffer. */

00394 extern LONG FAR TRIOCALL TMCGetTimeout(HANDLETMC hdmc, LONG FAR* pTimeout);
00395 /* Get current time-out value. The default is 1000.
00396 
00397    hdmc              Handle to the Galil controller.
00398    pTimeout          Buffer to receive the current time-out value in
00399                      milliseconds. Output only. */
00400 
00401 extern LONG FAR TRIOCALL TMCSetTimeout(HANDLETMC hdmc, LONG lTimeout);
00402 /* Set time-out value. The default is 1000. If the time-out value is set to
00403    zero, the DLLs will ignore time-out errors. This is useful for sending
00404    Galil commands which do not return a response, such as providing records
00405    to the DL or QD commands.
00406 
00407    hdmc              Handle to the Galil controller.
00408    lTimeout          Time-out value in milliseconds. */
00409 
00410 extern LONG FAR TRIOCALL TMCAssignIPAddress(PCONTROLLERINFO pcontrollerinfo, int fVerbose);
00411 /* Assign the IP Address to a DMC-2100 or DMC-1415 Ethernet controller. The controller
00412    must be in BOOTP broadcast mode.
00413 
00414    pcontrollerinfo   Galil controller information. Users should declare a
00415                      variable of type CONTROLLERINFO, fill-in the ulSerialNumber
00416                      and hardwareinfo.socketinfo.szIPAddress of the controller
00417                      to be assigned an IP address, and pass the address of the
00418                      variable to the function.
00419    fVerbose          Verbose mode if TRUE */
